channel.title: One thing
channel.description: How do I add skillcape emotes to meh server (please give me the codes) and where do I add them.. And how can I add them to the emote list as just one emote well etc. You know what I mean..

item.title: One thing

item.description:
@Da_0wnz wrote:

Where do I add that???

item.title: One thing
item.dc:creator: @Envion Envion
item.description:
@Envion wrote:

[quote=“primadude, post:2, topic:190871”]Simple.

Add this into your Client.Java:

if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape] == ID of your skillcape) { // The skillcape c.startAnimation(Emote you want); c.actionTimer = 8; c.playerGfx(gfx you want, 0);

Then change the (ID of your skillcape) to whatever the skillcapes ID is.
Change (The skillcape) to what ever your skillcape is called.
And change (emote you want) and (gfx you want) to whatever GFX and Emote you would like the emote to have.[/quote]

And some of you wonder why you bloat your files so quickly.

Not everything needs to be hardcoded. In fact, if you can store it in a database, you probably should.

Read full topic

item.title: One thing
item.dc:creator: @primadude Primadude
item.description:
@primadude wrote:

Simple.

Add this into your Client.Java:

if (c.playerEquipment[c.playerCape] == ID of your skillcape) { // The skillcape c.startAnimation(Emote you want); c.actionTimer = 8; c.playerGfx(gfx you want, 0);

Then change the (ID of your skillcape) to whatever the skillcapes ID is.
Change (The skillcape) to what ever your skillcape is called.
And change (emote you want) and (gfx you want) to whatever GFX and Emote you would like the emote to have.

Read full topic
